oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Red Foley Show
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpt from radio program the Red Foley Show, featuring Red Foley (host/performer), Slim Wilson (performer), Paul Mitchell (performer), Boyd Bennett (performer), and Jim Reeves (performer) , date and episode number unknown.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Tabby West; Paul Mitchell; Boyd Bennett; Jim Reeves; Slim Wilson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening statement and theme (Red Foley) -- (00:30) Chattanoogie Shoe Shine Boy (Red Foley) -- (02:07) Foley thanks the audience -- (02:17) U.S. Armed Forces commercial - (02:25) Foley introduces Tabby West -- (02:35) Waltz Of The Angels (Tabby West) -- (04:11) Foley and West talk and introduces Paul Mitchell -- (04:38) Little Rock Getaway (Paul Mitchell piano) -- (06:00) Foley thanks Mitchell -- (06:08) Just A Petal From A Faded Rose (Red Foley) -- (08:20) U.S. Armed Forces commercial -- (09:55) Foley talks and introduces Boyd Bennett -- (10:22) Bennett talks and introduces the next tune -- (10:41) Click Clack (Boyd Bennett) -- (13:02) Foley introduces Jim Reeves -- (13:26) Reeves thanks Foley, and talks about trading baseball for music -- (13:56) Anna Marie (Jim Reeves) -- (16:15) U.S. Treasury Department commercial -- (17:26) Papa's Jumpin' (Slim Wilson) -- (18:32) Foley thanks the band, and introduces the next tune -- (18:46) Where Could I Go But To The Lord (Red Foley) -- (20:50) Closing statements and theme (Red Foley)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Red Foley show (Radio program); Foley, Red, 1910-1968; West, Tabby; Mitchell, Paul (Musician); Bennett, Boyd; Reeves, Jim; Wilson, Slim;
